IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Improving the health, independence & quality of life of all older people. Providing leadership to healthcare professionals, policy makers & the public by implementing & advocating for programs in patient care, research, professional & public education and policy.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The AGS mission is to improve the health, independence and quality of life of all older people. The Society works to achieve this mission by: (1) seeking to expand the geriatrics knowledge base through initiatives that promote basic, clinical and health services research regarding the health of older adults; (2) working to increase the number of healthcare professionals employing the principles of geriatric medicine when caring for older persons by supporting the expansion of geriatric education in all applicable health professions, and promoting the development of systems of care and practice redesign that facilitates the provision of quality geriatric care; (3) seeking to recruit physicians and other healthcare professionals into careers in geriatrics through efforts to ensure that geriatrics is a viable, attractive, and rewarding career choice; (4) seeking to guide public policy through advocacy so policy supports improved health and healthcare for seniors; and (5) raising public aw
IRS990.Desc: Publication of the Journal of the American Geriatrics Society and other medical journals for the dissemination of articles related to current educational topics on geriatric medicine for all health care professionals.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Grants and Special Projects: (1) Geriatrics for Specialists Initiative, which helps prepare surgeons and related medical specialists to meet the unique healthcare needs of the nation's growing population of older adults. (2) Career Development Scholars Program, which improves the health of older adults by increasing geriatrics expertise across targeted specialties with scholarships. An annual conference allows awardees to interact with innovators in aging research to further develop leadership skills. (3) The development of a report that presents an evidence-informed clinical rationale and business case for person-centered care approaches that can be adopted in whole, or in part, in a variety of healthcare settings.(4) The development of a multi-platform app for smartphones and tablets that is based on our Multimorbity Guiding Principles and draws upon the AHRQ National Guideline Clearinghouse.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Public Affairs, Outreach, Education and Membership

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part II-B, Line 1i - Other Activities Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AGS advocates and informs congress/legislators on the field of geriatrics and the importance of the health care of older adults. It informs its members of legislative alerts and updates by making available information on its website and throught e-mail alerts about important issues related to geriatrics and the healthcare of older adults. AGS also reviews curreng legislation as it related to geriatrics and the care of older adults by offering summaries and status information about key bills related to the field of geriatrics. AGS informs its membres as to how the individual congressmen and congresswomen may vote and has voted on such bills. Finally, AGS informs its members of how best to communicate with congressional staffers and help their membesr understand the legislative process.

AGS does not believe its financial statements include any uncertain tax positions. Tax filings for periods ending December 31, 2012 and later are subject to examination by applicable taxing authorities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AGS has a formal policy that outlines the grant selection process. This includes submission of an application, proposal and budget that is reviewed by a Grant Selection Committee. Upon approval, all grants require periodic expense reports compared with the approved budget and written program status reports. These reports are reviewed and approved by the Program Manager prior to AGS dispensing additional grant funding.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d: Other Program Services Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: Public Affairs, Outreach, Education and Membership

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Management reviewed a draft of the form 990 with the audit committee and provided edits to the tax preparer. After this process was performed, the form 990 was sent to the full board of directors prior to being filed with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board of Directors, committee members, senior staff and others acting on behalf of AGS must complete a conflict of interest disclosure form. Completion is required annually or as needed if an individual's circumstances change.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors has formed a compensation committee comprised of executive committee members who performed an annual review of the chief executive officer and senior staff.
